title: Radio City Rockettes offer a sneak preview of their routine for New York's Christmas Spectacular
text:
Advertisement

Rehearsals are in full swing for the 2019 Christmas Spectacular, a show in New York City starring precision dance company Radio City Rockettes.

Stunning photos and video give a behind-the-scenes look at preparations for annual musical holiday stage show set to take place at Radio City Music Hall.

The 90-minute show features more than 140 performers and an original musical score, and combines singing, dancing, and humor with traditional scenes. The popular production has been performed since 1933 when the Music Hall presented lavish live stage shows along with the latest Hollywood feature films.

The Radio City Rockettes are the longest-running precision dance company in the US. Founded in 1925 in St. Louis, Missouri, the Rockettes have performed at Radio City Music Hall in Manhattan, New York City, since 1932.

They also star in the annual Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. They are renowned for their iconic style of dance and their precise, synchronized moves.

This year's production will run from November 8 until January 5. Two months ahead of the show's opening night, the performers were already in full rehearsal-mode at St. Paul the Apostle Church on Tuesday, October 22 as they practiced their dance moves with impossible precision and grace.

Founded in 1925 in St. Louis, Missouri, the Rockettes have performed at Radio City Music Hall in Manhattan, New York City, since 1932

Members of the Rockettes rehearse for their upcoming Christmas show. Members of the renowned dance company also star in the annual Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade

description: Precision dance company Radio City Rockettes were in full rehearsal mode at St. Paul the Apostle Church in NYC on Tuesday as they prepare for the 2019 Christmas Spectacular.
